Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Illinois \Il`li*nois"\, n. sing. & pl. (Ethnol.) A tribe of North American Indians, which formerly occupied the region between the Wabash and Mississippi rivers. [1913 Webster]

Illinois n 1: a Midwest state in north-central United States [syn: {Prairie State}, {Land of Lincoln}, {IL}] 2: a member of the Algonquian people formerly of Illinois and regions to the west 3: the Algonquian language of the Illinois and Miami peoples
